text:
<@U7SL518D6> shared a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U7SL518D6/FAN25PLQ7/color_field_output_macro.txt|color field output macro> and commented: Wrote this like 3 times in the last few weeks, figure someone else will find it valuable.
The idea is if you’re going to use a color input in a custom module you pop the macro somewhere in your code, and you can call the macro to output the value.

Basically if there is transparency the macro converts the color to rgba, if there isn’t it leaves it Hex.

Kinda feel like this could be built in to jinjava |convert_rgba or something.

Feedback - there needs to be a way to create global modules without needing to create a dummy template to do it.

Also the page editor scares away the marketers from touching global content because it now displays <https://spin.d.pr/AEIj6a+>

This isn’t true, the module has editable options, and marketers SHOULD be able to edit these modules without going into the design manager, They do however need to understand editing a global module edits it everywhere the module is used.

I am a huge fan though of the fact that now custom modules can become global modules, makes life easier. Please someone fix the UI issues above though.
Feedback on editing the values of custom modules within a page template - <https://spin.d.pr/1yggOu+> if there’s a required field you can still publish the template page with it not filled in.

Repeat Feedback, just running into this again… would be nice if `{{require_js("URL","footer")}}` had an extra parameter for adding attributes.

An example is I have a an API I’m hitting and I only need to load the API once, but the module is used multiple times.

The documentation encourages using `<script async defer src="API URL">`

I can’t add this when using require_js
require_js will only load each js file once, even it’s included in multiple modules on the page
more options would be useful for adding defer though
When cloning a staged page it doesn’t clone to staging but to website pages./
eek I’ve seen that bug before that was a big mess. or actually a similar bug I guess.
It isnt hard to work around. You can stage the page then delete the live page But it is more annoying than anything
Curious if anyone has had any issues with old custom modules showing a `Component Disconnected` warning when upgrading modules from the old design manager?
